oai_dc:dc.dc:title: PROPAGATION OF WIND WAVES ON TIDES
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Tolman, Hendrick L.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: wind waves
wave propagation
tide
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Effects of instationary depths and currents in tides on shelf seas on wind wave propagation are investigated using two numerical models in two academical situations representing shelf sea conditions. It is shown that changes in absolute frequency, which are induced by the instationarity of depth and current, are significant in contrast to what is usually assumed. If these changes are neglected large and unpredictable errors may occur in calculated changes of wavenumber and amplitude.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 21 (1988): Proceedings of 21st Conference on Coastal Engineering, Torremolinos, Spain, 1988.; 36
